bibl.title: One Verse of Mimnermus? Latin Elegy and Archaic Greek Elegy.
bibl.note: Paper delivered at a conference on Latin genre, which took place in Thessaloniki (May 2011). - Callimachus had given Mimnermus a special importance for Roman Callimacheans. Considers in particular Roman knowledge and exploitation of that poet. - Avec résumé en anglais.

bibl.title: "Generic Interfaces in Latin Literature. Encounters, Interactions and Transformations"

bibl.seg: Richard Hunter, One Verse of Mimnermus? Latin Elegy and Archaic Greek Elegy.

Theodore D. Papanghelis, Stephen J. Harrison & Stavros Frangoulidis (edd.), Generic Interfaces in Latin Literature. Encounters, Interactions and Transformations = Trends in Classics. Supplementary Volumes. 20 (Berlin - New York, 2013) pp. 337-349.

Paper delivered at a conference on Latin genre, which took place in Thessaloniki (May 2011). - Callimachus had given Mimnermus a special importance for Roman Callimacheans. Considers in particular Roman knowledge and exploitation of that poet. - Avec résumé en anglais.
